channel.title: bayesian-computation on YoungStatS
channel.description: Recent content in bayesian-computation on YoungStatS

item.title: Recent Advances in Approximate Bayesian Inference
item.description: Recent Advances in Approximate Bayesian Inference In approximate Bayesian computation, likelihood function is intractable and needs to be itself estimated using forward simulations of the statistical model (Beaumont et al., 2002; Marin et al., 2012; Sisson et al., 2019; Martin et al., 2020). Recent years have seen numerous advances in approximate inference methods, which have enabled Bayesian inference in increasingly challenging scenarios involving complex probabilistic models and large datasets.
